stories.title: CCP pulls support from Alibaba Cloud for not reporting Log4j flaw to gov first

stories.text:
I currently work as a software dev. I am on a 2 week break.

I am going to a remote hilly area, reason because I want to be away from my home, city for a while, to "reset" and dont wanna look at my screen.

Some advices I got as to what to do: 1. Don't do anything tech. Don't code (for fun), or read tech (blogs, etc.) 2. Also dont seclude yourself in your remote home, just get out. (i love exploring anyway, so I'll be out)

I'm not planning to read any (tech or non-tech) books but personally I'd love to read Data Intensive book.

So during this time, what do you suggest I do? I can't reveal my location, so you don't have to suggest any location-specific advices, just any general ones you feel like.

How would you or how did you spend a break like this? What should I (or not) do?

Thanks for your time :)
stories.title: Ask HN: How do I spend my 15 days break?
